DOC.brief_title: Topiramate Augmentation Bulimia Nervosa Partial Responders
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study determine whether addition augmentation medication ( topiramate 200mg/d ) confer additional reduction symptomatology BN patient receive six week standard pharmacological treatment fluoxetine 60 mg/day equivalent partial response symptomatic remission .
DOC.criteria: Male female subject meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual IV edition ( DSMIV ) diagnostic criterion bulimia nervosa ( BN ) . Subjects must age 18 60 year . Subjects must currently demonstrate partial response standard BN pharmacotherapy treatment . Women childbearing potential must practice accepted method birth control ( barrier method oral contraceptive ) negative pregnancy test baseline . Subjects must good general health history , laboratory assessment physical exam . Subject 's BMI must > 20 < 27 kg/m^2 . Subjects allergic topiramate . Subjects meet DSMIV criterion anorexia nervosa . Women pregnant nursing time study . Subjects experience clinically significant , unstable neurological , cardiac , hepatic renal disease narrow angle glaucoma . Subjects history nephrolithiasis . Subjects serum potassium < 3.0 mmol/L Subjects start psychotherapy study . Subjects currently past history meeting DSMIV diagnostic criterion schizophrenia , schizoaffective disorder , bipolar disorder . Subjects receive antipsychotic agent , mood stabilizer , antianxiety agent nonantidepressant psychotropic agent currently . Subjects currently history within past year meeting DSMIV diagnostic criterion substance abuse . Subjects experience clinically significant suicidal ideation ( subject refer appropriate caregiver ) . Subjects participate investigational drug study past 30 day . Subjects receive prescription medication oral contraceptive interact study medication .
